column3: Description
Copies subdirectories. This option automatically excludes empty directories.
Copies subdirectories. This option automatically includes empty directories.
Copies only the top n levels of the source directory tree.
Copies files in restartable mode. In restartable mode
column4: should a file copy be interrupted
column5: Robocopy can pick up where it left off rather than recopying the entire file.

column3: Copies files in backup mode. Backup mode allows Robocopy to override file and folder permission settings (ACLs). This allows you to copy files you might otherwise not have access to
column4: assuming it's being run under an account with sufficient privileges.

column3: Copies files in restartable mode. If file access is denied
Copies using unbuffered I/O (recommended for large files).
Copies all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.

Specifies which file properties to copy. The valid values for this option are:D - DataA - AttributesT - Time stampsS - NTFS access control list (ACL)O - Owner informationU - Auditing informationThe default value for this option is DAT (data
Specifies what to copy in directories. The valid values for this option are:D - DataA - AttributesT - Time stampsThe default value for this option is DA (data and attributes).
Copies files with security (equivalent to /copy:DATS).
Copies all file information (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).
Copies no file information (useful with /purge).
Fixes file security on all files
Fixes file times on all files
Deletes destination files and directories that no longer exist in the source. Using this option with the /e option and a destination directory
column4: allows the destination directory security settings to not be overwritten.

column3: Mirrors a directory tree (equivalent to /e plus /purge). Using this option with the /e option and a destination directory
column4: overwrites the destination directory security settings.

column3: Moves files
column4: and deletes them from the source after they are copied.

column3: Moves files and directories
column4: and deletes them from the source after they are copied.

column3: Adds the specified attributes to copied files.  The valid values for this option are: R - Read onlyA - ArchiveS - SystemH - HiddenC - CompressedN - Not content indexedE - EncryptedT - Temporary
Removes the specified attributes from copied files. The valid values for this option are: R - Read onlyA - ArchiveS - SystemH - HiddenC - CompressedN - Not content indexedE - EncryptedT - Temporary
Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only.
Creates destination files by using 8.3 character-length FAT file names only.
Turns off support for paths longer than 256 characters.
Monitors the source
column4: and runs again when more than n changes are detected.

column3: Monitors the source
column4: and runs again in m minutes

column3: Creates multi-threaded copies with n threads. n must be an integer between 1 and 128. The default value for n is 8. For better performance
column4: redirect your output using /log option.The /mt parameter can't be used with the /ipg and /efsraw parameters.

column3: Specifies run times when new copies may be started.
Checks run times on a per-file (not per-pass) basis.
Specifies the inter-packet gap to free bandwidth on slow lines.
Copies junctions (soft-links) to the destination path instead of link targets.
Don't follow symbolic links and instead create a copy of the link.
Copies no directory info (the default /dcopy:DA is done).
Copies files without using the Windows Copy Offload mechanism.
Requests network compression during file transfer
